types.RedisConfig: fields: Addr string, Password string, DB int, PoolSize int, DialTimeout time.Duration, ReadTimeout time.Duration, WriteTimeout time.Duration

types.SecurityConfig: fields: HttpOnly bool, Secure bool, SameSite http.SameSite, Domain string, Path string, MaxAge int, CookieName string
types.SessionManager: fields: storage StorageBackend, idGenerator *SessionIDGenerator, cookieSecurity *CookieEncryption, csrfManager *CSRFTokenManager, config *SessionConfig, securityConfig *SecurityConfig

types.RequestContext: fields: IPAddress string, UserAgent string, Timestamp time.Time, Headers map[string]string, RemoteAddr string, ForwardedFor string

types.ValidationFlowResult: fields: Valid bool, SessionData *SessionData, Renewed bool, SecurityWarnings []string, Error error
types.DeviceListResult: fields: Devices []*UserSessionDisplay, TotalCount int, CurrentDevice string, Error error

types.RiskScore: fields: OverallScore float64, ComponentScores map[string]float64, RiskFactors []string, Confidence float64, Timestamp time.Time, RecommendedAction string

types.AuditEvent: fields: EventID string, Timestamp time.Time, EventType string, UserID string, SessionID string, SourceIP string, UserAgent string, Resource string, Action string, Result string, Details map[string]interface{}, RiskScore float64, ComplianceFlags []string, PreviousEventHash string, EventHash string
types.TamperProtectedLogger: fields: storage AuditStorage, hmacKey []byte, lastEventHash string, eventCounter uint64, retention time.Duration
types.GeographicStats: fields: CommonLocations []LocationFrequency, CountryDistribution map[string]int, MaxTravelSpeed float64
types.TemporalStats: fields: HourDistribution [24]int, DayDistribution [7]int, SessionDurations DurationStats, LoginFrequency FrequencyStats
types.DeviceStats: fields: KnownUserAgents map[string]int, DeviceTypes map[string]int, BrowserDistribution map[string]int, OSDistribution map[string]int
types.AccessStats: fields: CommonEndpoints map[string]int, DataAccessPatterns map[string]int, FeatureUsage map[string]int

methods.SetSessionTransport(w http.ResponseWrite: writes session ID using appropriate transport
methods.CreateSession(ctx context.Context, userI: generates new session with security setup
methods.RegenerateSessionID(ctx context.Context,: creates new session ID for fixation prevention

methods.RegisterDeviceSession(ctx context.Contex: creates new device session with tracking metadata
methods.EnforceSessionLimits(ctx context.Context: checks concurrent session limits and evicts if necessary
methods.ListUserSessions(ctx context.Context, us: returns all active sessions for user with display metadata
methods.RevokeUserSession(ctx context.Context, u: terminates specific session with complete cleanup
methods.ParseUserAgent(userAgent string) DeviceI: extracts device information from User-Agent string
methods.ResolveLocation(ipAddr string) (*Locatio: returns approximate geographic location for IP address
methods.DeviceListFlow(ctx context.Context, user: retrieves and formats active sessions for display
methods.ExtractRequestContext(r *http.Request) *: creates security context from HTTP request
methods.Execute(ctx context.Context, operation f: execute operation with circuit breaker protection
methods.VerifySessionIDEntropy(generator Session: performs statistical analysis on generated session IDs
methods.SimulateFixationAttack(ctx context.Conte: attempts to set known session ID before authentication
methods.NewSessionInspector(sm *SessionManager,: creates debugging utility for session analysis
methods.RegisterDebugEndpoints(mux *http.ServeMu: adds debugging endpoints to HTTP router
methods.healthCheckHandler(w http.ResponseWriter: performs basic session system health validation
methods.CalculateSessionRisk(ctx context.Context: evaluates multiple risk factors and returns comprehensive risk assessment
methods.ProcessSAMLAuthRequest(ctx context.Conte: handles incoming SAML authentication requests from service providers
methods.LogEvent(ctx context.Context, event *Aud: records audit event with tamper protection
methods.NewBehaviorAnalyzer(storage StorageBacke: creates analyzer with Redis caching for performance
methods.NewTamperProtectedLogger(storage AuditSt: creates audit logger with integrity protection

constants.SESSION_ID_PREFIX: sess_ - prepended to all generated session IDs
constants.MaxConcurrentSessions: configurable limit for simultaneous sessions per user
constants.baselineMinSamples: 50 - minimum samples required before establishing behavioral baseline

terms.session fixation: attack where attacker sets victim's session ID to known value
terms.session hijacking: stealing and reusing legitimate session tokens
terms.CSRF: Cross-Site Request Forgery - forged requests using victim's session
terms.server affinity: requirement that user requests go to specific server instance
terms.sticky sessions: load balancer routing users to same server for session consistency
terms.entropy: measure of randomness/unpredictability in session identifiers
terms.AES-GCM: authenticated encryption mode providing confidentiality and integrity
terms.TTL: time-to-live - automatic expiration of stored data
terms.command delegation: Session Manager delegates tasks to specialized components
terms.data transformation: session data changes form as it moves between components
terms.validation chains: security properties maintained across component interactions
terms.collision resistance: property ensuring duplicate session IDs remain computationally infeasible
terms.birthday paradox: mathematical principle describing collision probability growth
terms.base64url encoding: web-safe variant of base64 using - and _ instead of + and /
terms.double-submit cookie pattern: CSRF protection using separate token cookies
terms.constant-time comparison: prevents timing-based attacks on token validation
terms.device fingerprinting: technique for identifying devices based on browser and system characteristics
terms.session enumeration: listing all active sessions for a user account
terms.concurrent session limits: maximum number of simultaneous sessions allowed per user
terms.session revocation: terminating specific sessions while preserving others
terms.eviction strategy: algorithm for selecting which sessions to terminate when limits are exceeded
terms.device registration: explicit user-controlled device identification and naming
terms.fuzzy matching: algorithm for recognizing devices with minor characteristic changes
terms.zombie sessions: partially cleaned up sessions that remain functional in some contexts
terms.circuit breaker pattern: prevents cascading failures by temporarily disabling failing operations
terms.race condition: concurrent operations that can produce inconsistent results
terms.clock drift: gradual divergence of system clocks in distributed systems
terms.idempotent operations: operations that produce same result when executed multiple times
terms.graceful degradation: system continues operating with reduced functionality during failures
terms.double-logout: simultaneous logout attempts from multiple sources
terms.optimistic locking: assume no conflicts, retry if conflict detected
terms.time synchronization: keeping clocks aligned across distributed systems
terms.property-based testing: testing approach using randomly generated inputs to verify invariants
terms.phantom sessions: expired sessions that still appear in enumeration results
terms.connection pool exhaustion: running out of available database/storage connections
terms.behavioral analysis: analyzing user patterns to detect anomalous activities
terms.risk-based authentication: adjusting authentication requirements based on calculated risk levels
terms.adaptive timeouts: session duration adjustments based on risk assessment
terms.step-up authentication: requiring additional verification for high-risk operations
terms.anomaly detection: identifying unusual patterns that may indicate security threats
terms.SAML: Security Assertion Markup Language for SSO federation
terms.OIDC: OpenID Connect protocol for modern SSO implementations
terms.tamper-evident logging: cryptographically protected audit trails that detect unauthorized modifications
terms.SIEM integration: bidirectional communication with Security Information and Event Management systems
terms.Zero Trust architecture: security model requiring verification of every access request
terms.behavioral fingerprinting: identifying users based on interaction patterns and habits
terms.compliance reporting: automated generation of regulatory compliance documentation
